articles.author: BRIAN SLODYSKO and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — The Democratic National Convention's third night showcased a familiar former president, Bill Clinton, and introduced more Americans to Minnesota Gov.
articles.title: Walz's night, Bill Clinton's dig at Trump, influencers flexing clout. DNC Day 3 takeaways

articles.author: JONATHAN J. COOPER, WILL WEISSERT and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris closes out the Democratic National Convention Thursday night when she accepts her party's historic presidential nomination and seizes one of her few remaining opportunities to appeal to an audience of millions.
articles.title: Democratic convention ends Thursday with the party's new standard bearer, Kamala Harris

articles.author: BRIAN SLODYSKO and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — The Democratic National Convention's third night showcased a familiar former president, Bill Clinton, and introduced more Americans to Minnesota Gov.
articles.title: Walz's night, Bill Clinton's dig at Trump, influencers flexing clout. DNC Day 3 takeaways

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — President Volodymyr Zelenskyy toured the northeastern Ukrainian region of Sumy on Thursday in his first visit to the border area since his forces entered Russian territory more than two weeks ago.
articles.title: Zelenskyy visits border area for the first time since Ukrainian forces entered Russia's Kursk region

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Some new Ukrainian soldiers refuse to fire at the enemy. Others, according to commanders and fellow fighters, struggle to assemble weapons or to coordinate basic combat movements.
articles.title: Poorly trained recruits contribute to loss of Ukrainian territory on eastern front, commanders say

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — Key mediator Egypt expressed skepticism Wednesday about the proposal meant to bridge gaps in cease-fire talks between Israel and Hamas as more details emerged a day before negotiations were expected to resume in Cairo.
articles.title: Key mediator Egypt expresses skepticism about the Gaza cease-fire proposal as more details emerge

articles.author: ROB GILLIES and JOSH FUNK
articles.description: TORONTO (AP) — Both of Canada’s major freight railroads have come to a full stop because of a contract dispute with their workers, an impasse that could bring significant economic harm to businesses and consumers in Canada and the U.S.
articles.title: Labor dispute stops Canadian freight railroads and could cause major economic disruption in US

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: ASHEBORO, N.C. (AP) — At his first outdoor rally since last month’s attempted assassination, Donald Trump spoke from behind bulletproof glass Wednesday in North Carolina at an event focused on national security.
articles.title: Trump speaks from behind bulletproof glass at first outdoor rally since his attempted assassination

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Kamala Harris has a husband, Doug Emhoff, who could make history as America's first gentleman spouse. Two stepchildren who call her "Momala.” A politically connected sister who is a top adviser and sounding board.
articles.title: Harris' family members are popping up around Chicago this week during the DNC. Here's who's who

articles.author: KATE PAYNE
articles.description: MADISON, Fla. (AP) — Tens of thousands of students have left Florida’s public schools in recent years amid an explosive expansion in school choice.
articles.title: School choice and a history of segregation collide as one Florida county shutters its rural schools
